articles.summary: Among the many messages in Ms. Carlile’s songs is a celebration of “the love that lets us share our name.”
articles.title: Review: Brandi Carlile’s Life Is Embedded in Her Music

articles.summary: With “To Pimp a Butterfly,” a challenging 75-minute story of “survivor’s guilt,” Mr. Lamar is doubling down on the concept album.
articles.title: Kendrick Lamar on His New Album and the Weight of Clarity

articles.summary: With its highly anticipated second album, this band of small-town misfits finally has a ticket out — not that they would ever leave.
articles.title: Alabama Shakes’s Soul-Stirring, Shape-Shifting New Sound

articles.summary: In her second sold-out show in New York, Ms. Trainor gave the concert performance of an almost-star.
articles.title: Review: Meghan Trainor Performs at Irving Plaza

articles.summary: Mr. Jesso had played just three proper shows as a solo artist before his television debut last month. His album comes out on Tuesday.
articles.title: Tobias Jesso Jr.’s Take on His New Album, Adele and Fame

articles.summary: Glenn Zaleski’s “My Ideal,” Marcus Miller’s “Afrodeezia” and Sleeping With Sirens’ “Madness” are being released on Tuesday.
articles.title: New Albums From Sirens, Zaleski and Miller

articles.summary: Led by Brittany Howard, the band unleashed raw confessions and extreme tempos at the second of two sold-out shows at the Beacon Theater.
articles.title: Review: Alabama Shakes Lifts Soul to a Different Plane

articles.summary: In real life, it was intended for Steve Tilston, a British folk singer. In Dan Fogelman’s new film, Al Pacino plays the recipient, an aging, overtanned singer who lost his soul to celebrity but may have a second chance.
articles.title: The Letter From John Lennon Behind ‘Danny Collins’
